attributes.action: Lower taxes of pensions for U.K. Armed Forces Officers who served for 20 years
attributes.background: U.K. Armed Forces Officers get paid pensions from the Govenment, however, the government then tax it up to 40%, even though they are risking their lives for the country.

attributes.action: Shorten School Days For Public High Schools
attributes.background: When I go to school all the work piles up sometimes and becomes really stressful, however when I get home there is not enough time to relax, do work, eat then sleep enough for the next day of school, I know a lot of others feel this way and I hope this gets solved.

attributes.action: Make the Pigeon our first national bird!
attributes.background: Pigeons are everywhere and are part of our current day-to-day lives.

attributes.action: private rented properties should be checked and certified  by council yearly.
attributes.background: council should check every property before allowing them to be rented out and should make a certain rules for estate agent to deal with tenant and protecting them.
attributes.additional_details: the flat i am renting is full of moulds, when i send my complain to estate agent in stead of resolving it and send me eviction letter !!! i am asking local council to protect tenants.

attributes.action: Speed up A&E times in UK hospitals
attributes.background: A&E's in the UK have long waiting times to see a nurse or a doctor in the hospital (including emergencies). This has put a lot of pressure on NHS staff which has resulted in longer times to wait.
attributes.additional_details:
- Aim is to speed up the waiting times within UK hospitals.
- Put more NHS nurses and doctors back onto wards.

attributes.action: Exempt Landlords from Stamp Duty if let to a local authority or Housing Trust
attributes.background:
Growing shortage of affordable property to rent.

Incentivise Landlords to rent to the public sector for a minimum of 5 years below market rates, in return for tax and duty relief.

Also introduce enhanced Interest Relief for long term Landlords committing to a 10 year or more investment term.
attributes.additional_details:
Stamp Duty & the reduction in interest relief has made investment in residential property much less favourable, the result, less investment in BuytoLet (BTL) properties and landlords have been selling existing stock ahead of the changes.

This reduction in stock and the high demand, will inevitably lead to  rent increases.

Incentivise investment by exempting Stamp Duty on all property let to the public sector for a 5 years term, long term landlords should benefit from enhanced interest relief

attributes.action: Make all Utility Companies publicly owned & Running Costs paid by the Tax Payer
attributes.background: I want the government to make all Utility Companies publicly owned as Non Profit Companies & cover all Running Costs by the Tax Payer. This will ensure the disabled, elderly & people out of work can heat their houses & not have to worry about bailiffs coming to their door for non payment of bills.
attributes.additional_details: Losing your job, being elderly or disabled is financially hard enough. Many have to deal with unscrupulous bailiffs for non payment of utility bills, leaving some feeling suicidal. These vulnerable people should not be asked to pay for utility bills that they cannot afford. However, this also means that the government can pay them less benefits as their utility bills are already covered. Plus if utility companies are non profit and publicly owned, everyone's bills will be cheaper to begin with.

attributes.action: Reform the public broadcasting licensing law.
attributes.background:
At the moment you cannot listen to a radio or play your own music in your place of work without a public broadcasting license. This includes in your own home if you are working from there. 

The current law isn't in the spirit of its intent, which is to require a media company to get a license.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.ppluk.com/

attributes.action: Theory test for car license has to be in all languages.
attributes.background: Allow people from different countries to get the license in their own language.

attributes.action: Allow people to do any reasonable course & still receive benefits.
attributes.background: People on jobseekers should be able to study full-time or part-time on any appropriate course without losing money, even if that course takes longer than 8 weeks.
attributes.additional_details:
On job seekers, they have to look for work for 35 hours a week. If they want to go to college they cannot claim benefits, so no income even though they want to get off jobseekers. We have low skilled people being forced to remain that way.

I am from a working class town, hundreds of people on job seekers. Many I meet want to go to college and do different courses, not only the basic courses, to achieve skills. If they choose to go to college they won't meet the 35 hours a week for seeking jobs and can’t claim help, so they are not allowed to improve as they won't be able to live without benefits. They become trapped in a life that has little sign of improving.

attributes.action: Create independent organisations to run the NHS and Education
attributes.background: The NHS and Education are perpetual footballs for politicians.  They see them as their way of "making policy" and "changing Britain".  In the same way as was done with the Bank of England, both the NHS and Education should be taken out of politics, and run by independent, expert organisations.
attributes.additional_details: Let's stop perpetual political reforms of the NHS and Education in the UK, and create stability.  Let's also stop politicians who have zero experience in health or education from making policy, and leave instead trust these tasks to panels of experts.  Only this way can be bring stability to, and take forward, our beloved organisations.

attributes.action: Make it law for any petition with 300k+ signatures to actually be debated
attributes.background: It is disingenuous of the government to state they will only consider debating a petition if it reaches 100k. I propose that if a petition reaches 300k it must be debated whether or not the subject has been debated on a previous occasion. We must have a mechanism that ensure debates are held.

attributes.action: Put a public multi-section recycling bin on over 50% of Britain's roads
attributes.background: Roads like mine don't have enough regular bins. The country simply needs more if you expect people not to litter or have recyclable items end up in landfill. Give us lot a chance to have nicer places to live. Give us somewhere to put our rubbish and recyclable items when we're out and about.
attributes.additional_details: There are about 250,000 roads or ways in the UK, so it would be too costly to cover them but we need to start somewhere.

attributes.action: Road improvements to dual carriageway between Polegate to Lewis
attributes.background: With the increased housing developments in and around Eastbourne and Polegate causing more traffic congestion along the A27 between Polegate to Lewis it's now time to dual carriageway this section of road

attributes.action: The banning of plastic carrier bags and plastic bottles.
attributes.background: Plastic carrier bags and plastic bottles have a MASSIVE detrimental impact on the world environment. Charging for these items in supermarkets etc is not enough. If they are not there we cannot buy them. These plastics are entering our food chain. Ban them now and make the world a better place.

attributes.action: Make training courses VAT exempt to encourage young people to learn new skills
attributes.background: I believe that training course should be VAT exempt as it helps young people learn new skills. VAT can be extremely expensive on week long course and puts may off taking them. By removing VAT from these courses it would encourage employers to invest in training to develop their employees.

attributes.action: Change the way that benefits are calculated to take cost of living into account
attributes.background: Benefit claimants living in an area where the cost of living is particularly high are at a disadvantage. Local Housing Allowance takes property prices in the applicant's area into consideration when calculating Housing Benefit entitlement, and I believe benefit rates should be calculated similarly

attributes.action: Include HGV training to the Government backed 24+ Advanced Learning Loans.
attributes.background: To expand the 24+ advanced learning government backed loan to cover HGV license acquisition. There is currently a shortage of 45-50,000 drivers in the UK. Other industries are benefiting from the loan but not an industry that can create 50,000 jobs & whereby the loan could be paid back quickly.
attributes.additional_details:
Driver shortage- http://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/oct/25/lorry-driver-shortage-christmas-deliveries-road-haulage-association

Courses covered: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/advanced-learner-loans-qualifications-catalogue

Ave pay for Class 1 (HGV 1) Driver £28,362 PA 
http://www.totaljobs.com/salary-checker/average-class-1-driver-salary

attributes.action: Change nhs policy that baby born before 24 weeks can intervene with life support
attributes.background: Babies born before 24 weeks in an NHS hospital should be given immediate emergency care to try get babies breathing if born not breathing or need the support when first born

attributes.action: Zero tax for 18-21 year olds in education and part time working
attributes.background: People between the age of 18 and 21 can't afford to pay tax on a part time job and don't have enough time for a full time job while in education.

attributes.action: Dissolve and amalgamate Cleveland Police in to Durham and North Yorkshire
attributes.background: The County of Cleveland no longer exists. Middlesbrough gets called North Yorkshire and Hartlepool Durham. The area has no identity, the Police Service is past its prime. Let's move forward & evolve; use the original boundaries of Durham and North Yorkshire as our Policing areas for 2020 & beyond.
attributes.additional_details:
The County of Cleveland was created in 1974 and named after the historic region, but not covering it all, and also including land north of the Tees that had until then been in Co Durham. It was situated around the Teesside urban area and included Middlesbrough, Stockton-on-Tees, Hartlepool and Redcar.
The county was abolished in 1996 with its boroughs becoming unitary authorities and the Tees re-established as the border between North Yorkshire and County Durham for ceremonial purposes only.

attributes.action: Clocks should be advanced one hour forward in winter instead of summer.
attributes.background: British Summer Time (BST) has been implemented since early 1900s. However, there is little benefit that can be gained. If instead of BST, we turn the clocks one hour forward in winter, we can benefit a lot from it. Particularly in those months when we need daylight i.e. October - February
attributes.additional_details:
An introduction of British Winter Time (BWT) as an alternative to BST would be helpful in winter such that: 

1. Decent daylight would be around 07:00 which is usually the time people are leaving for work. 
2. Sunset will be at approximately 16:30 instead of 15:30 nowadays. We can have more of daylight. 

We already have too much daylight in summer and sunset during summer is at a time when people are going to sleep. Decreasing one hour from both sunrise and sunset wouldn't make much difference.

attributes.action: Criminal Justice System to accept polygraph results as evidence.
attributes.background: For serious offences a Polygraph test should be used as evidence. For crimes such as historic child abuse where independent witnesses will not really exist. As nearly all children who are abused will by themselves. These results should be used or funding for research should be given.
attributes.additional_details:
We want the results to be used or funding granted to make these tests more accurate. 
 
Some people believe that the lie detectors are 90% accurate when other believe they are around 70% accurate. http://abcnews.go.com/US/story?id=92847

When eyewitness statements are used as evidence and their accuracy can be within this %.

What we want is some form of lie detector to be used in the near future as evidence.

attributes.action: Introduce plain bottles for alcoholic drinks to discourage drinking.
attributes.background: The government decision to introduce plain packaging for cigarettes while leaving alcoholic brands to market their poison in fancy bottles is hypocrisy. Correct this mistake by forcing them too to get rid of their marketing. If the government is interested in saving people's health, this is obvious.
attributes.additional_details: One does not need to Google for long to find that alcohol is the nation's biggest killer, that it - especially in this season - severely strains out emergency response teams and is highly addictive. Not advocating prohibition of any substance, but it is simply not right to villify one drug while leaving another untouched. I cannot imagine how anyone can justify such a move with a clear consciousness.

attributes.action: Make landlords & agents give 24 hours notice to access shared rental housing.
attributes.background: I currently live in a share house where the agency accesses the home unannounced. Because my housemates and I complained, the agency tried to threaten me and we feel like we can't enjoy this new home because the laws regarding 24 hours notice to rentals don't include share houses, but they should.
attributes.additional_details: On citizensadvice.org.uk, it's states that landlords "...should always ask for your permission and should give you at least 24 hours notice." However, if you stay in lodgings where the landlord provides a room-cleaning service or where you share a room with other lodgers, your landlord can enter without permission. All my housemates and I have either had our items tampered with in communal areas or our rooms accessed without permission or without due notice. These exceptions should be illegal.

attributes.action: When selecting route for HS3 include Manchester to carlisle.
attributes.background: HS2 is meant to provide a link from the North to the south. A full upgrade of the UK railway network is required to reach the actual North of England carlisle  in place of targeted more advanced areas where spending is already in place.

attributes.action: Make it a legal obligation to have a mobile phone holder/mount fitted in cars.
attributes.background: It should be a legal obligation to have a phone dock, holder or mount fitted in your car to pass an MOT. It is illegal to have your phone in your hand while driving but for most, unfortunately it continues to be a problem. We hope to reduce the deaths associated with mobile phone use while driving.
attributes.additional_details: A recent video showed a lorry driver crashing into a line of cars, including one full of a family, because he was on his phone. He would not have taken his eyes off the road if he had had his mobile phone in a mount. It is devastating what has happened to this family, but for the driver as well. All he did was something that Everyone does at one time or another and he was unlucky. A family were killed instantly, this could have been avoided.

attributes.action: Make a legal requirement for realistic road crash simulations of child car seats
attributes.background: Having done countless hours of research on car seats, I purchased a Nuna Rebl for my son based on positive reviews. However, it has now been listed as a dangerous car seat, yet meets the UN ECE R129 standards. Worryingly, these standards are extremely poor, and not representative of actual crashes.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently UN UCE R129 standards require seats to perform well in the following, totally unrealistic, crash simulations: 
Front impact: 31 mph
Rear impact: 18.6 mph
Side impact: 14.9 mph
These of course are not representative of many car accidents. If you hit another car head on, both driving at 20mph (a lower speed limit than in most residential areas), there will be a 40mph impact, which isn't covered by the existing required testing, putting children's lives at risk.

attributes.action: A referendum to change our system of electing a representative
attributes.background: A call for a referendum to change our system of electing a representative with 3 options either keep our current system which is First past the post or change to either Alternative vote or the Single transferable vote to ensure a more representative Parliment/Democracy.

attributes.action: Close all retail shops on Sundays
attributes.background: All retail shops should be closed on Sundays. Shops under a certain square footage have been allowed to open on Sundays since the Sunday Trading Act of 1994. This immediately enabled retailers to treat Sunday like a normal trading day. This should not be the case. Sundays should be the day of rest.

attributes.action: Ban speed limited vehicles (70 MPH) from using the outside lane of a Motorway.
attributes.background:
Cars, Vans or other forms of vehicle that are fitted with a 70 MPH speed limiter should not use the outer lane of a motorway.
As with HGV, they are restricted from using the outer lane.
attributes.additional_details:
We've all been here... You are happily driving along the motorway and come to a situation where you look to over take a vehicle ahead from the middle lane to the outer lane.
However the vehicle ahead of you is also trying the same manoeuvre but is limited to 70MPH and you are then stuck behind them for quite some time before you are able to pass.
This can sometimes lead to a lengthy tailback in the traffic flow.

attributes.action: Give all homeless charities £1000 pounds so they can help homelessness.
attributes.background: I want this done because there are so many homeless people in the uk. Whenever I walk to the shops I see them... Helpless, cold and hungry. The majority of people will ignore them but there are some kind people who donate and help them. They are treated as inhumane.
attributes.additional_details: Charities could make the number of homeless people decrease and if they had £1000 they could do it

attributes.action: Abolish The Benefits Cap
attributes.background: The Benefits Cap discriminates against people who have fallen on bad times.The Benefits Cap's goal was to encourage people to work.Recent statistics show that only 5% of people find work thanks to the Cap. It's not working, and all we are doing is causing distrust in the government.

attributes.action: Make the use of essay writing services a criminal offence
attributes.background: The number of companies offering essay writing services to students at British universities is on the rise. These companies charge students hundreds of pounds to have an 'expert' write an essay that is passed off as the student's own work.
attributes.additional_details: This is a blatant and unfortunately undetectable form of cheating by plagiarism. The best way to reduce this problem is to make the use of such essay writing services a criminal offence. In addition, this law would ideally be accompanied with a ban on such services from operating in the U.K., and banning the IP address of any service operating outside of the UK from being accessed via UK internet hosts.

attributes.action: Review the law on e-cigarette tank sizes allowing them to be larger and safer.
attributes.background: For an e-cigarette user the refilling process is the point when they are most likely to come into contact with e-liquid (which contains nicotine, a toxic substance). Manufacturers minimize the risk involved with the refilling process by reducing the number of times the device has to be refilled....
attributes.additional_details: ...this is currently achieved by making the size of the tanks larger. Many EU countries recognize this logic and have chosen not to limit the size of refillable tanks, however the UK government has gone beyond the requirements of the TPD by restricting the maximum size of the refillable tanks to 2ml (The TPD restricts the size of pre-filled and disposable tanks but not refillable tanks). This decision has increased the risk of toxic poisoning for over 2 million users of refillable e-cigarettes.

attributes.action: NHS England and NICE need to approve the funding for LAL disease (wolmans)
attributes.background: NHS England and NICE have rejected to fund a life saving treatment for children suffering from LAL/Wolmans disease-stating it's too expensive. The appeal is taking place on the 25th April and we need the funding to be approved, otherwise children suffering from this disease will die within months.
attributes.additional_details: My baby niece Aiza, is only 11 months old and if this appeal doesn't go through she will be one of the first to die due to being the youngest. We've been told her health will detroriate within 3months. This treatment is a breakthrough for Wolmans disease, in the  past there was NO treatment and infants would die by six months old. Today, thanks to the treatment, there is a six year old who had been on the clinical trials for this treatment and is leading a normal life.This treatment WORKS and the evidence is the fact that we have children LIVING past the six months mark and leading normal lives. NHS England and NICE are refusing to fund the treatment, condemning the sufferers to DEATH. We cannot have this happening in today's day and age! PLEASE HELP by signing the petition below!

attributes.action: Provide additional national funding for Tier 2 social housing.
attributes.background: Homelessness affects towns and cities up and down the UK. Although we need more affordable housing options generally, Tier 2 (shared housing with support) is needed, in particular, so that the homeless can progress forwards from emergency help in Tier 1, and from Tier 2 begin to restore their lives.
attributes.additional_details: There has been a lack of Tier 2 social housing. This research emerged during a project I was undertaking in York - after further research, I believe that this lack of housing in Tier 2 is not confined to York. Indeed, lack of social housing is merely reflective of the national problem of a lack of affordable housing for all. According to Shelter England, nearly 41,000 households with dependent children were living in temporary accommodation at the end of December 2012. This was before even the worst of austerity. Waiting lists for social housing are long and the vulnerable need affordable housing now!

attributes.action: Abolishing of the bus driver CPC Card for local UK domestic driving
attributes.background: Once EU law is changed to UK law in march 2019 the current CPC card issued under EU law to be abolished for all uk domestic bus companies that do not operate EU style bus routes.Only companies that travel into Europe with continental drivers will be required to carry and hold the current card
attributes.additional_details: Uk domestic driving will no longer require a CPC drivers qualification card

attributes.action: Offer Gibraltar and other territories the opportunity to become part of the UK
attributes.background: Enlarge the UK and secure the complete protection of all of our overseas Territories and Dependancies by offering them an opportunity to vote on becoming part of the United Kingdom and having full representation in parliament.
attributes.additional_details:
Stop the likes of Spain making claims on the sovereignty of Gibraltar and the same for Argentina with the Falkland Islands.

And lets enlargen the UK and make the most of our land and peoples

attributes.action: impose stress tax for the most stressfull demanding jobs and compensate workers.
attributes.background: Its medically proven that stress shortings life expectancy and i`m calling on the government to tax employers a stress tax on the most frustating, stressful and demanding jobs and use the money to lower national insurance and income tax contributions on a ratio depending on the level of stress.

attributes.action: Companies/Banks to notify users when their personal data is sold.
attributes.background: Companies like Google and Facebook sell personal data of the users to ad companies, and generate billions of pounds as profit, and pay virtually no or little tax. I would like companies to notify users when their data is sold, so users can stop it from happening or ask for a commission.
attributes.additional_details:
If you want to know how much your data cost 
http://www.ft.com/cms/s/2/927ca86e-d29b-11e2-88ed-00144feab7de.html?ft_site=falcon#axzz2z2agBB6R

Some background 
https://www.theguardian.com/news/datablog/2014/apr/22/how-much-is-personal-data-worth 

Even banks can sell transaction data
http://www.independent.co.uk/money/spend-save/more-companies-put-data-about-their-customers-on-sale-8679852.html

attributes.action: Create an optional council tax welfare supplement to support people in need.
attributes.background: Councils should be able to open up a welfare fund for local people to add into if they can afford to or want to. This fund can then only be used to support the elderly, disabled or other groups in need of help locally. This could be an optional extra on a yearly council tax bill.
attributes.additional_details: Happiness studies show that the happiest countries and societies are those where all in society are supported adequately. The Scandinavian and Dutch models are fantastic examples. Whilst it may mean greater taxes, it also creates much happier societies.

attributes.action: Stop funding animal testing with taxpayers' money.
attributes.background: On average, billions of pounds a year from tax payers' money goes towards animal testing. However, a great percentage of the British public do not agree with animal testing, and it is wrong our money funds such a disgusting act.

attributes.action: Allow MPs only one additional job not exceeding 20 hours a week
attributes.background: MP's should first and foremost serve their electorate. An example is the MP for Tatton. A constituency of 84,500 yet he has 5 jobs. Not fair to his electorate.

attributes.action: Support for young deaf people when it comes to doing GCSEs in mainstream schools
attributes.background: Many young deaf people in mainstream schools do not achieve any support throughout their GCSEs causing them not to get as many GCSEs as they could have.

attributes.action: Urge Donald Trump to withdraw the energy independence executive order!
attributes.background:
The executive order suspends more than half a dozen measures to reduce climate change and boosts fossil fuel production, rolling back vital Obama-era rules aimed at curbing climate change. 

If the executive order is successfully instated, the rate of climate change could increase rapidly.
attributes.additional_details:
If the executive order is successfully instated, it would not only have serious consequences in the United States, but also in the United Kingdom and the world; the long term impacts would be devastating and threaten the livelihoods of many humans and animals.

Therefore, I feel that the British government has a duty to try to prevent the Executive order from being imposed, and if necessary, to impose sanctions on the United States.

attributes.action: All CCGs to be required to continue to offer G/F staples on prescription.
attributes.background: Many people suffer with Coeliac disease, And the threat of losing prescriptions would put huge financial strain on middle to low income families as the cost of basic necessities is so much higher than standard food. Each health authority controls it's spending on prescriptions.

attributes.action: Lower university fees back to £1000 per year.
attributes.background: Throughout 10 years university fees has risen by £8000. It is a fee majority of us will never end up paying back over the 30 years. It gets paid from tax payers money which could be inputted into nhs or better use. Also by lowering this charge would encourage more people to want to go to university.

attributes.action: Make teenagers who are aged over 15 have the right to vote
attributes.background: Most people in the UK believe that teenagers who are aged over 15 have there own opinions based on the law and parliament. Teenagers in the UK should have the right to vote and express their own opinions regarding politics. They should have the power to decide what is right for them and the country.

attributes.action: Make a vehicle with its engine running whilst not driving, a criminal offence.
attributes.background: As we all hear in the news, over ten thousand people in the UK die each year due to air-pollution related diseases. I regularly see stationary vehicles with their engines running whilst the occupants are texting, talking etc. and I believe something should be done.
attributes.additional_details: I live in the North West of England and regularly see vehicles parked up with their engines running when there is no one in the vehicle or the driver is talking or on their phone, etc. It really angers me to witness this, as I think of the number of people that die each year and we all know the effect global warming is having on our planet. It is an unnecessary waste of fuel and it is having a huge impact on the environment.
